oai_dc:dc.dc:title: New aspects of intramolecular coordination in organochalcogen (Se/Te) chemistry
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KAUR, R
MENON, SC
SINGH, HB
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: crystal-structures
complexes
ligands
derivatives
n,n-dimethylbenzylamine
selenoether
diselenides
intramolecular coordination
hybrid chalcogen (se/te) ligands
tellurium macrocycle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Using intramolecular coordination as an approach, the synthesis and isolation of hybrid selenium ligands, monomeric selenolate complexes of mercury and tellurium azamacrocycles is described. It has been demonstrated that intramolecular coordination can be used as a potential approach to isolate stable, monomeric organo-selenium and -tellurium species which are otherwise unstable.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: PROCEEDINGS OF THE INDIAN ACADEMY OF SCIENCES-CHEMICAL SCIENCES,108(3)159-164
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Symposium on Modern Trends in Inorganic Chemistry,HYDERABAD, INDIA,AUG 17-19, 1995
